Posted By: James_Kernaghan (4/24/2013 2:21:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I for one can't wait to see the Wizards article that talks about how secretly awesome and Jonny-tastic this card is.  
  
"Okay, guys, I know what you're thinking. But you can use her with cards that care about highest converted mana cost! And she's soooo much harder to hit with the deadly new [Gaze of Granite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaze of Granite)! And...wait, this is super secret tech here...you can ENCHANT HER. Or even, if you're really willing to splash for colorless, you can even try out some equipment. [Hedron Matrix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hedron Matrix), anyone? And if you reanimate her, hoo doggy, now you're just getting KUH-RAZY."  
  
Also, I like the flavor text. We too will put the ranks of the guild before you, Emmara.
posts.html:

Posted By: ItsHarvestTime (4/23/2013 6:16:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
2/5  
She's a [Hexplate Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hexplate Golem) (rated 2.0), at rare (-0.25), with color restrictions (-0.25). Granted, she does have one ability (+0.5), but tokens will still have trouble with:  
[Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus)  
[Cyclonic Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cyclonic Rift)  
[Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict)  
[Sever the Bloodline](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sever the Bloodline)  
[Mutilate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mutilate)  
[Killing Wave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Killing Wave)  
[Gaze of Granite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaze of Granite)  
And other cards like [Aetherize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aetherize) and [Blustersquall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blustersquall)  
I think people are rating her low because they expected her to be a flavorful and awesome guild champion, but she's almost a vanilla 5/7.

Posted By: 13KmSpaceRock (4/24/2013 4:36:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The one thing that's bothering me about this is that the guildmasters of Selesnya only act as support to tokens rather than generate them. [Trostani](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trostani) was pretty decent, but she only gains you life if you don't have a means of making tokens.   
  
You know what? Maybe that's just it. Selesnya can't 'grow' without the help of its guild. Without cards like [Call of the Conclave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call of the Conclave) or [Advent of the Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Advent of the Wurm), they're just creatures with a high toughness.  
  
It's nice this card was made. I think people are just a little sour about cost.
posts.html:
The one thing that's bothering me about this is that the guildmasters of Selesnya only act as support to tokens rather than generate them. Trostani was pretty decent, but she only gains you life if you don't have a means of making tokens.

You know what? Maybe that's just it. Selesnya can't 'grow' without the help of its guild. Without cards like Call of the Conclave or Advent of the Wurm, they're just creatures with a high toughness.

It's nice this card was made. I think people are just a little sour about cost.

posts.post_content: Settle down people. She's this bad because Selesnya also got [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence), [Advent of the Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Advent of the Wurm), Alive and Well, [Bronzebeak Moa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bronzebeak Moa), [Phytoburst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phytoburst) (playable because trample is prevalent), [Skylasher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skylasher), [Trostani's Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trostani's Summoner) and [Unflinching Courage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unflinching Courage), all in this *small* set, all *excellent*.
